title.narrative: 1.2 PoD Consortium builds capacities

description.narrative: 1.2 PoD Consortium Builds each other’s, its partner networks’ and local CSOs’ capacity

title.narrative: # of consortium partners/partners/country office members trained

description.narrative: # of consortium partners/partners/country office members trained

comment.narrative: 08 staff from NIMD have formally been trained in Feminist approaches to programming by AMwA. The staff included M02 and F06.
The target of 13 staff was not achieved because the staffs of the consortium partner AMwA were unable to attend the feminist training.

title.narrative: # of CSOs with increased organizational capacities (youth led)

description.narrative: # of CSOs with increased organizational capacities (youth led)

comment.narrative: According to the responses, there are no youth led organizations with increased capacities that are attributable to any of the PoD partners. These organizations are however able to identify their capacities sourced from Institutions of higher learning and technical specialists as well as other subject matter specialists.
The fundraising strategy was developed by NIMD Uganda

title.narrative: 1.3 PoD Consortium engages in joint L&A at all levels
1.3 PoD Consortium engages in joint L&A at all levels

description.narrative: 1.3 PoD Consortium engages in joint L&A at all levels
1.3 PoD Consortium engages in joint L&A at all levels

title.narrative: # of studies for evidence-based L&A disseminated

description.narrative: # of studies for evidence-based L&A disseminated

comment.narrative: One study has been conducted by the time of the baseline report. A political economy analysis has been conducted although it has been delivered late. The study with very useful insights will help to understand the operating context of the PoD and also shed light into the programmatic aspects of NIMD Uganda. The study, whose final report is yet to be submitted because of the delays by the Consultant is the second PEA that NIMD Uganda has conducted since the 2016 study. The study also gave insights into the media performance of IPOD, whose secretariat is the NIMD country office.
1 Political Economy Analysis was done.

title.narrative: 2.1 Y&W leaders strengthen their movements or organizations
2.1 Y&W leaders strengthen their movements or organizations

description.narrative: 2.1 Youth and women leaders strengthen their movements or organizations
2.1 Youth and women leaders strengthen their movements or organizations

title.narrative: # of women/youth leaders trained

description.narrative: # of women/youth leaders trained

comment.narrative: As at the baseline reporting, a total of 165 youth leaders have been trained. These leaders from the National Youth Council structures from four sub-regions of the Country and 39 districts have been trained in lobbying and advocating as well as influencing political decision making processes. However, no women leaders have been trained so far
The target for 2021 was 25, that would bring the Total number to 190 but NIMD managed to train only 22 Participants

title.narrative: # of CSOs included in the PoD programme (youth led)

description.narrative: # of CSOs included in the PoD programme (youth led)

comment.narrative: Currently, there are no youth led CSOs included in the program. This is because the program being in its inception phase is still identifying these CSOs through which it will best deliver on the program targets.

title.narrative: 2.2 Y&W leaders lobby and advocate in decision-making spaces
2.2 Y&W leaders lobby and advocate in decision-making spaces

description.narrative: 2.2 Youth and women leaders lobby and advocate in decision-making spaces
2.2 Youth and women leaders lobby and advocate in decision-making spaces

title.narrative: # of political/civic actors taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth

description.narrative: # of political/civic actors taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth

comment.narrative: As a result of engagements under the PoD program, eight actors(Entities) had taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth. These included Political parties such as DP, FDC, UPC, PPP, NUP, JEEMA, and CP as well as one civic actor, West Minister Foundation for Democracy (WFD)
These are civil society and 7 political parties under the IPOD arrangement

title.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

description.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

comment.narrative: At the time of the baseline survey, no lobbying and advocacy activities had been undertaken to make the political system more inclusive in 2021. Ruth Asiimwe of Uganda Youth Network noted that because of Government restrictions on engagements resulting from the COVID19 pandemic, engagements with policy makers and power holders aimed at lobbying them for action aimed at making the political system more inclusive have been curtailed. The Chairperson of the Women’s league for DP also observes that the initially intended interventions have also been hard hit given the economic crisis that COVID19 has plunged the global economy in.

title.narrative: 2.3 Y&W leaders Amplify diverse young and women voices
2.3 Y&W leaders Amplify diverse young and women voices

description.narrative: 2.3 Youth and women leaders amplify diverse young and women voices
2.3 Youth and women leaders amplify diverse young and women voices

title.narrative: # of created/opened spaces for women/youth (at sub-national level)

description.narrative: # of created/opened spaces for women/youth (at sub-national level)

comment.narrative: As at baseline, there were no created spaces for either women and youth at sub national levels. However, there are some spaces that have been re-activated after many years of redundancy. These however flow from the national levels including regional parliaments that have prior been passive.
Sub-National Regional activitie were organized in Fort Portal and Mbarara. 64, and 68 young people were reached

title.narrative: # of regional L&A campaigns

description.narrative: # of regional L&A campaigns

comment.narrative: One regional lobby and advocacy engagement has been undertaken in the year 2021 under the PoD program. This engagement targeted the youth leaders aimed at influencing the policy on the conduct of Youth elections from grassroots to National level, which affects the young people especially their participation in the National political processes.

description.narrative: 3.1 Political and civic actors address grievances through mediation
3.1 Political and civic actors address grievances through mediation

title.narrative: # of interparty dialogue meetings (at national level)

description.narrative: # of interparty dialogue meetings (at national level)

comment.narrative: Six (6) interparty dialogue meetings have been held at the national level so far since the inception of the PoD program. These include meetings of Secretaries General from the various political parties, the IPOD summit as well as IPOD council meetings.
these included the IPOD council meetings, the summit and Secretaries Generals meetings

title.narrative: # of multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings (at sub-national level)

description.narrative: # of multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings (at sub-national level)

comment.narrative: Two (2) multi stakeholder dialogue meetings have been held at the sub national level thus far in 2021.
The Regional Youths engagements in Fort Portal and Mbarara also acted as multi- stakeholders

title.narrative: # of representatives (male/female) of political actors have participated in democratic values oriented training activities (e.g. democracy schools

description.narrative: # of representatives (male/female) of political actors have participated in democratic values oriented training activities (e.g. democracy schools

comment.narrative: Since the Uganda program does not run any democracy school, there has not been any trainings under such an institution. Relatedly, no democratic values oriented training has taken place thus far.
